The fallout from even a global nuclear conflict with thousands of explosions would still not wipe us out and in the unlikely case that we could shape up and stop behaving like children we could probably save our civilization to. The effect of fall out from nuclear bombs has for different reasons been heavily exaggerated. There has been an interest in making a nuclear war look worse than it would be to support the MAD doctrine. One side want to make the weapons look worse than they are to the other side to scare them from starting a conflict while another group was interested in making the weapon look worse to their own population to make sure that their own side didn't start the war. However since none of the nuclear countries ever did any real attempt to educated their people in how to behave (duck and cover does not really cover it) the effect would actually be a lot worse than it had to be, so in a way it is a self-fulfilling prophecy and a way for both side to maximize the disaster. Sweden and Switzerland are the only countries that actually planed and prepared for a nuclear conflict by extremely ambitious project to protect their citizen. This was possible since they where among the few rich countries that did not have any interest in scaring it's own population from using the nukes, since they never got any. Sweden literally build ABC fallout shelter in basically every apartment house and Switzerland build enormous ones in their mountains. However this was only one part of the survival strategy, the most important part was that they tried to educated their populations about how to survive after an attack.

This will later on form a SPORANGIUM (a spherical or maybe oval shape, depends on the species), which would now contain spores, allowing dispersal of spores. So, as long as the branch of hyphae is present on the ground, mushrooms would still grow from that same ground. (P.S. This is what I recall from my subject not so long ago, if you have some corrections, please do so, I am sorry, I might be wrong with this)

This is a survival adaptation for mushrooms against predators or other factors that would endager their survival. So, this spores will grow in the soil and have a structure called HYPHAE (it looks like a rod). The hyphae will later mitotically divided (still in the soil) and branch of forming the Mycelium. Therefore Mycelium is branches of hyphae. The Mycelium will later find its way on to the top of the soil and into the aerial portion (just like a plant that is growing).

So, in a mushroom, if you look closely, on the underside of the mushroom cap, you will observe lines that are arranged radially. If you look into this individual lines through a microscope, you will see spherical bodies. This spherical bodies contain spores. If the mushroom gets distrubed, for example, an earthquake caused the mushroom to sway strongly, this microscopic spherical bodies containing spores are released from the mushroom, allowing the spores to be dispersed into the environment.

But the real question is, how did those fungi survived a nuclear bomb, which release a very high energy, known as the nuclear energy? The survival of fungi, for example in Chernobyl, is also because of their life cycle. Mushrooms are dimorphic, meaning they have two life stages, the Yeast stage and the Filamentous stage. And in this topic, how mushrooms survived, Filamentous Stage is the cause.
